title: Level-Up Your Fitness and Save Big With These Garmin Watch Deals
text:
From Men's Health

Right now Amazon.com has some killer deals on premium Garmin smartwatches, perfect to snap up if you’re ready to take better control of your fitness or if someone deserves a really good gift this year (we’re looking at you Mom and Dad).

The Garmin Fenix 5 Sapphire watch normally would set you back $599.99, but Amazon has slashed the price to $398.92—that’s over $200 worth of savings.



The 47-millimeter smartwatch with GPS is designed to be the ultimate timepiece in the durability and ruggedness department, so you can take it backpacking, snowboarding or white water rafting. It has a stainless steel bezel, buttons and rear case with a silicone band for the most comfortable sport fit, all in classic black. The scratch-resistant sapphire lens means it will withstand your toughest workouts and outdoor activities.

For tracking day-to-day workouts, the Fenix 5 is more than equipped to help you take your athletic performance to the next level. It automatically tracks heart rate, your steps, sleep and calories burned, basically all the stats you’ve come to expect from any kind of smartwatch or fitness tracker.

What sets the Fenix 5 apart is its ability to monitor the aerobic and anaerobic effects of your workouts. The VO2 max estimator calculates the maximum volume of oxygen you can consume during exercise, and from this data can predict potential race finish times. There’s also a recovery advisor, with a recovery timer. Runners will love the in-depth analytics on performance condition, lactate threshold, cadence and stride length.

For a slightly more entry-level purchase into the world of smartwatches, we suggest the Garmin Instinct, also on sale on Amazon.com for $234.69 from its original $299.99 price tag. Available in a range of sporty shades, the Instinct is also designed to withstand the toughest training conditions, matching military standards for thermal, shock and water resistance.

It boasts a built-in 3-axis compass, barometric altimeter and multiple global navigation satellite systems, not just GPS, for the most accurate location tracking.

Like the Fenix 5, this is the watch we’d take to trek mountains in a remote area but even when you’re just at the gym you’ll be impressed with its heart rate, activity and stress tracking.

Plus, when you’re not training like a beast, both Garmin swartwatches send smart notifications to alert you to phone calls, texts and calendar alerts, and automatically upload your data to the Garmin Connect online fitness community so you can compare stats with your fellow athletes.
